_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The six things that can't be done [an6.9: A person accomplished in view can't fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain are made by oneself.
A person accomplished in view can't fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain are made by another.
A person accomplished in view can't fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain are made by both.
A person accomplished in view can't fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain arise by chance.
A person accomplished in view can't fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain are not made by oneself.
A person accomplished in view can't fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain are not made by another.
